document_data.name: Riyataivin
document_data.mainbody: '''Riyataivin''' was a merchant and investor in caravan trades in the city of [[Waterdeep]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities: Riyataivin had no set house in Waterdeep, but rather spent time in various different rooming houses and inns in the [[Waterdeep/Southern Ward|Southern Ward]]. In terms of business, he made consistent profit margins by dealing in the buying and selling of cargo, draft animals, [[wagon]]s, and warehouse space.
document_data.Relationships: Riyataivin was generally well respected among his colleagues. He had no particularly special knowledge or connection or the [[Lords of Waterdeep]].
document_data.History: In [[1357 DR]],<ref group="note">Page 14 of ''[[Waterdeep and the North]]'' states that the news provided in the ''[[Forgotten Realms Campaign Set]]'', "...is current [to this book] as of early Mirtul, in the [[Year of the Prince]]. the [[Shadow Thieves]] of [[Athkatla]] sent an [[assassin]] to kill Riyataivin, having mistaken his penchant for acting mysterious as evidence of him being a Lord of Waterdeep. Armed with [[poison]]ed [[dagger]]s, the assassin attacked an [[adventurer]] by mistake who closely resembled the merchant.
